Thanks.  I already sent a question to a java developer's group about
the po=
ssibility of reading in an image into an array of color variable
type.  It'=
ll be a while before I'm ready for that point, but it'll
probably take a wh=
ile to get a response.  I don't really like the
quality of the gif or jpg. =
 You can really see the difference on the
column tiles.  I'm going to spend=
 a little time designing a temporary
interface to allow me to view maps.

-=

>
> Openglad loade=
d all the tile images and sprites when the program

d the specific map's scen and pix files when

ly, I think it was when the player pressed

PGs of the game's graphics for you. You can get at
> them at:
http://snowst=
orm.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/snowstorm/openglad-e/trunk/pix/jpg/

t check out the openglad-e svn repository and look in
> trunk/pix/jpg. The =
PNGs in the directory above that (trunk/pix) have

tead of the pink color, so if there's some way
> you can work with PNGs, th=
ey'll probably be a bit easier. I used 100%

 are lossless, so those should be more or
